title: P2: Create references/ files (fitness tests + code templates)
description:
## Agent Task: Create References (Phase 2)

**Role:** Create reference files for fitness test templates and code templates.

### Agent Context
- **Files to create:** plugins/scaffolder/skills/scaffold-ts/references/fitness-tests.md, plugins/scaffolder/skills/scaffold-ts/references/code-templates.md
- **Files to read:** plugins/scaffolder/skills/scaffold-ts/SKILL.md (for consistency)

**fitness-tests.md content:**
- architecture.test.ts spec: dependency direction (domain must not depend on infrastructure/application), bounded context isolation (no cross-context imports)
- naming.test.ts spec: file naming conventions for aggregates (-aggregate.ts), repositories (-repository.ts), infrastructure (in-memory- prefix or -adapter.ts suffix), events (-event.ts), value objects (in value-objects/ dir)
- complexity.test.ts spec: LOC limits (300 all, 200 domain/infra), LCOM96b < 0.5 for application services and domain aggregates
- coupling.test.ts spec: coupling factor < 0.3 (overall, application, infrastructure), distance from main sequence < 0.5 (application, domain, all modules)
- All use archunit npm package with allowEmptyTests: true

**code-templates.md content:**
- Shared kernel EventBus interface and DomainEvent type (exact TypeScript)
- InMemoryEventBus implementation notes
- Domain event union pattern with type discriminant
- Zod input validation pattern with ZodError -> INVALID_INPUT error code mapping

- **Acceptance gate:** Both files exist; fitness-tests.md covers all 4 test files; code-templates.md covers shared kernel, domain events, Zod patterns
- **Architectural constraints:** Content must match user original definition; no invented behavior
close_reason: Both reference files created with all required sections
